Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that holding your breath as a red dot moves from one point to another is not a valid test for COVID-19.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough scientific evidence or support to prove its validity as a COVID-19 test.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that being able to hold your breath for a certain duration indicates that your lungs are healthy and disease-resistant, which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The World Health Organization and medical experts provide alternative explanations and refute the claim, stating that a breathing test is not reliable for testing the presence or absence of the COVID-19 virus.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness and accuracy of the test, suggesting that it can determine if someone is "COVID-19 free at the moment" with just a simple breath-holding exercise.
